name: Michael Wiradharma

education.degree: B.S. Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences

awards: Silver Award in World Mathematics Invitational 2018
Bronze Award in World Mathematics Championships 2020

work experience.summary: • Created AI chatbot that recommends business strategies, saving 5+ hours weekly in client research.• Optimized backend by rewriting database queries and created new APIs using Express.js, Hasura, andPostgreSQL, reducing software load times by 50%.• Designed UI using Figma and Next.js to create application which maintains 10 active B2B clients, valued at $5M.

• Prototyped and researched last-mile logistics mobile app that streamlines grocery purchase for 100 active users.• Developed entire mobile app using Vue and Hasura, increasing user productivity by 2 hours weekly.• Assessed UI/UX feedback from users to routinely develop application and enhance user experience.

• Migrated prior website technologies such as scheduling algorithms from Ruby on Rails to Django, facing over200,000 members globally.• Managed user administration using Google Workspaces for 100+ new members every semester.• Created internal scripts to maintain operations which align communications for over 300 active members.

• Gathered various sponsors through engaging website UX and CTA, raising up to $3,000 in club funds.• Maintained operations of BISA website, for 1000+ Indonesian students, alumnus, and working professionals.• Wrote creative monthly-newsletters and adapted information according to data-driven responses.

projects.name: Gitlet
projects.summary: • Implemented data structures in Java to imitate features of Git Versional Control System as a personal project.• Optimized search algorithms using both BFS and DFS to manage repo histories.• Maintained program state of branches during different instances through Serialization library and OOP.

projects.name: Garuda Hacks
projects.summary: • Led online-hackathon operations, managing 3,000 participants with over $146,000 raised in funding for prizes.• Represented minority South East Asian communities in the bay area through participants and prizes• Co-founded sibling hackathon Komodo Hacks, which raised $5,000 in prizes with over 130 participating high-school students in Jakarta.

projects.name: TransJakarta
projects.summary: • Designed mobile app to solve public transport pain points and save up to 3 hours in daily commute of users• Drew wireframes and prototypes to gain feedback from commuters• Developed application using React Native and presented to TransJakarta Digital Director for implementation.
